research_question: At R=2.5A (deep dissociation), the state is nearly maximally entangled (alpha=-1.38). Z0/Z1 terms vanish while X0X1/Y0Y1 dominate completely. Does the error plateau, or does X/Y basis noise cause unbounded error growth?
description: VQE H2 at R=2.5A on qubits [2,4]. Deep dissociation. The state is almost entirely |Bell>. g1=0.027 (tiny Z contribution), g4=0.141 (large X/Y). Pure test of X/Y basis measurement fidelity.
